metadata.title: USN-5382-2 -- libinput vulnerability
metadata.description: USN-5382-1 fixed a vulnerability in libinput. This update provides the corresponding updates for Ubuntu 22.04 LTS.  Original advisory details:   Albin Eldst√•l-Ahrens and Lukas Lamster discovered libinput did not properly  handle input devices with specially crafted names. A local attacker with  physical access could use this to cause libinput to crash or expose  sensitive information.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5382-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libinput-dev - 1.20.0-1ubuntu0.1 libinput-tools - 1.20.0-1ubuntu0.1 libinput10 - 1.20.0-1ubuntu0.1 libinput-bin - 1.20.0-1ubuntu0.1 No subscription required
